It needs an exit or quit button for one thing.
summary: Would not exit gracefully, had to end task

description: Compared this against other popular players and this is by far the lightest and fullest featured. Others either chew up copious amounts of RAM or are too barebones to do playlists, select artist, etc. This hits a sweet spot of features and efficiency.
Powerful for large collections, runs smoothly on a real old device. If it was a little bit more customizable I would have given 5 stars.

I've used Guayadeque for years on Ubuntu. I was upset when I switched to Debian a few months ago and couldn't find it. Then I switched to Fedora a few days ago and there it was!
Guayadeque is powerful, light, feature rich, handles large libraries, and more. I'd like a mini player, but that's not must have feature.

I don't know why Gnome software says it is proprietary code. I'm pretty sure it's up on git hub.
summary: The only music player that functions the way I want
